samples.input: Who created the R programming language?

messages.content: Who created the R programming language?

content.text: R was created by Ross Ihaka and Robert Gentleman at the University of Auckland, New Zealand. They began the project in the early 1990s, with the first official release made in 1995. The name "R" comes from the first letter of the creators' first names and is also a play on the name of the S programming language, which R was designed to implement.

R was created by Ross Ihaka and Robert Gentleman at the University of Auckland, New Zealand. They began the project in the early 1990s, with the first official release made in 1995. The name "R" comes from the first letter of the creators' first names and is also a play on the name of the S programming language, which R was designed to implement.

samples.input: In what year was version 1.0 of R released?

messages.content: In what year was version 1.0 of R released?

content.text: R version 1.0.0 was released on February 29, 2000. This marked the first official stable release of R, though development of the language had begun several years earlier by Ross Ihaka and Robert Gentleman at the University of Auckland, New Zealand.

R version 1.0.0 was released on February 29, 2000. This marked the first official stable release of R, though development of the language had begun several years earlier by Ross Ihaka and Robert Gentleman at the University of Auckland, New Zealand.
